languages.text: "Это — тассерций. Удивительный камень, рожденный недрами планеты. Он, как и любой другой, гнется и плавится под инструментом, но для того, чтобы скульптура ожила, в него нужно вложить душу". {n}Одна из рук старика, будто не подчиняясь ему, возникает из-за края статуи и касается лысой головы своего хозяина.{/n} "Работа оставляет на душе мозоли. Моя давно покрылась струпьями".

"This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."
languages.original_text: "Это — тассерций. Удивительный камень, рожденный недрами планеты. Он, как и любой другой, гнется и плавится под инструментом, но для того, чтобы скульптура ожила, в него нужно вложить душу". {n}Одна из рук старика, будто не подчиняясь ему, возникает из-за края статуи и касается лысой головы своего хозяина.{/n} "Работа оставляет на душе мозоли. Моя давно покрылась струпьями".

traits.locale_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

"This is thassertium. A fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. It bends and melts under the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their soul into their craft." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more they work, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

"This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

"A fascinating stone. It bends and melts under the sculptor's tool. But for this to happen, they must craft with both their hands and their soul." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "And the soul obtains calluses the more it works. Mine has long since become covered in scabs, but my lord is too enamoured with my talents to grant it release."

"This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

"This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. It bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into their craft." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

"This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

languages.text: “这种材料叫做塔瑟拉水晶，是来自这颗行星的迷人矿藏。在雕刻师的手中，它与其他材料类似，可以弯曲、熔化，但若是想让雕像变得栩栩如生，雕刻师必须将自己的灵魂注入其中。”{n}他的手从雕像后面伸了过来，轻轻抚摸着雕像的头，仿佛那只手拥有自己的意志一样。{/n}“不过，雕得越多，灵魂的茧子就会越厚。至于我的灵魂，早已结满了痂。”
languages.original_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

traits.locale_text: “这种材料叫做塔瑟拉水晶，是来自这颗行星的迷人矿藏。在雕刻师的手中，它与其他材料类似，可以弯曲、熔化，但若是想让雕像变得栩栩如生，雕刻师必须将自己的灵魂注入其中。”{n}他的手从雕像后面伸了过来，轻轻抚摸着雕像的头，仿佛那只手拥有自己的意志一样。{/n}“不过，雕得越多，灵魂的茧子就会越厚。至于我的灵魂，早已结满了痂。”

languages.text: «Esto es thassertio, una piedra fascinante que nace en las entrañas de este planeta. Como cualquier otra, es maleable y se funde bajo las herramientas del escultor, pero para que la escultura cobre vida plena, el autor debe volcar su alma misma». {n}Una de sus manos emerge de detrás de la estatua y acaricia su cabeza con suavidad, casi como si tuviese voluntad propia.{/n} «Pero el alma se encallece cuando más trabaja el escultor, y la mía hace mucho que está cubierta de costras».
languages.original_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

traits.locale_text: «Esto es thassertio, una piedra fascinante que nace en las entrañas de este planeta. Como cualquier otra, es maleable y se funde bajo las herramientas del escultor, pero para que la escultura cobre vida plena, el autor debe volcar su alma misma». {n}Una de sus manos emerge de detrás de la estatua y acaricia su cabeza con suavidad, casi como si tuviese voluntad propia.{/n} «Pero el alma se encallece cuando más trabaja el escultor, y la mía hace mucho que está cubierta de costras».

languages.text: "Bu tasertiyum, bu gezegenin bağrından doğmuş büyüleyici bir taştır. Diğerleri gibi o da heykeltıraşın elinin altında bükülüp erir ama heykelin gerçekten canlanması için heykeltıraşın, ruhunu katması gerekir." {n}Ellerinden biri heykelin arkasından çıkıp sanki kendi iradesiyle hareket ediyormuş gibi nazikçe başına dokunuyor.{/n} "Ancak heykeltıraş ne kadar çok çalışırsa ruh o kadar nasır tutar. Benimki çoktan kabuklarla kaplandı."
languages.original_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

traits.locale_text: "Bu tasertiyum, bu gezegenin bağrından doğmuş büyüleyici bir taştır. Diğerleri gibi o da heykeltıraşın elinin altında bükülüp erir ama heykelin gerçekten canlanması için heykeltıraşın, ruhunu katması gerekir." {n}Ellerinden biri heykelin arkasından çıkıp sanki kendi iradesiyle hareket ediyormuş gibi nazikçe başına dokunuyor.{/n} "Ancak heykeltıraş ne kadar çok çalışırsa ruh o kadar nasır tutar. Benimki çoktan kabuklarla kaplandı."

languages.text: 「これはタッセリウムです。この惑星の深部から採れる興味深い石です。普通の石のように彫刻家の道具で曲げたり、溶かしたりできますが、彫刻に本気で命を吹き込むためには、彫刻家はその作品に魂を込めなければなりません」{n}彼の手の一つが彫刻の後ろから現れ、頭を優しく触り、それ自体に意志があるようである。{/n}「しかし、彫刻家がもっと働くと、魂にタコができます。わしのはかさぶたに覆われてから長いです」
languages.original_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

traits.locale_text: 「これはタッセリウムです。この惑星の深部から採れる興味深い石です。この石は彫刻家の道具で曲げたり、溶かしたりできますが、彫刻に本気で命を吹き込むためには、彫刻家はその作品に魂を込めなければなりません」{n}彼の手の一つが彫刻の後ろから現れ、頭を優しく触り、それ自体に意志があるようである。{/n}「しかし、彫刻家がもっと働くと、魂にタコができます。わしのはかさぶたに覆われてから長いです」

languages.text: « C'est du thassertium, une pierre pour le moins fascinante née dans les entrailles mêmes de cette planète. Si les outils permettent de la façonner comme toute autre pierre, pour que la sculpture prenne véritablement vie, le sculpteur doit y mettre toute son âme. » {n}Comme animée d'une volonté propre, l'une de ses mains émerge de derrière la statue et touche délicatement sa tête.{/n} « Plus le sculpteur travaille, plus l'âme se couvre de callosités. Voilà bien longtemps que la mienne est couverte de croûtes. »
languages.original_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet. Like any other kind, it bends and melts beneath the sculptor's tool, but for the sculpture to come to life in earnest, they must put their very soul into it." {n}One of his hands emerges from behind the statue and gently touches his head, seemingly of its own volition.{/n} "The soul, however, obtains calluses the more the sculptor works, and mine has long since become covered in scabs."

traits.locale_text: « C'est du thassertium, une pierre pour le moins fascinante née dans les entrailles mêmes de cette planète. Si les outils permettent de la façonner comme toute autre pierre, pour que la sculpture prenne véritablement vie, le sculpteur doit y mettre toute son âme. » {n}Comme animée d'une volonté propre, l'une de ses mains émerge de derrière la statue et touche délicatement sa tête.{/n} « Plus le sculpteur travaille, plus l'âme se couvre de callosités. Voilà bien longtemps que la mienne est couverte de croûtes. »

languages.text: "Das ist Thassertium, ein faszinierender Stein, der in den Eingeweiden dieses Planeten entsteht. Wie alle anderen ist er biegsam und schmilzt fast unter dem Werkzeug des Skulpteurs, doch damit die Skulptur wirklich zum Leben erweckt, muss Ersterer seine Seele hineinlegen." {n}Eine seiner Hände taucht hinter der Statue auf und streichelt offenbar völlig eigenständig seinen Kopf.{/n} "Die Seele jedoch trägt Schwielen davon, je mehr der Skulpteur arbeitet, und die meine ist schon lange über und über mit Schorf bedeckt."
languages.original_text: "This is thassertium — a fascinating stone born from the bowels of this planet.
